briefdescription.para: SysTick TIMER Software Reset Request Key.

detaileddescription.para:
This function set the system Timer load value.
value
init value for system timer.
Load value is 64bits wide.
SysTimer_GetLoadValue

This function get the system Timer current value.
current value for system timer.
Load value is 64bits wide.
SysTimer_SetLoadValue

This function set the system Timer compare value.
value
compare value for system timer.
Compare value is 64bits wide.
If compare value is larger than current value Timer interrupt generate.
Modify the load value or compare value less to clear the interrupt.
SysTimer_GetCompareValue

This function get the system Timer compare value.
compare value for system timer.
Compare value is 64bits wide.
SysTimer_SetCompareValue

This function set the system Timer MSTOP bit.
mstop
0 stop timer and 1 start timer.
Bit0 is used to start and stop. Set bit0 timer start. Clear Bit0 Timer stop.
SysTimer_SetMstopValue

This function set the system Timer MSTOP bit.
0 timer stop and 1 timer is running.
SysTimer_SetMstopValue

briefdescription.para: Set system Timer MSIP to trigger SW interrupt.
Clear system Timer MSIP to clear SW interrupt.

detaileddescription.para:
This function get the system Timer MSIP bit.
0 SW interrupt set and 1 SW interrupt clear.
Bit0 is SW interrupt flag. Bit0 is 1 then SW interrupt set. Bit0 is 0 then SW interrupt clear.
SysTimer_SetSWIRQ; SysTimer_ClearSWIRQ;
Set_MTVEC

This function will do software reset request through TIMER/
Software need to write SysTimer_TIMER_MSFRST_KEY to generate software reset request
The software request flag can be cleared by reset operation to clear
The software reset is sent to SoC, SoC need to generate reset signal and send back to Core
This function will not return, it will do while(1) to wait the Core reset happened
Initializes the System Timer and its non-vector interrupt, and starts the System Tick Timer.

In our default implementation, the timer counter will be set to zero, and it will start a timer compare non-vector interrupt when it matchs the ticks user set, during the timer interrupt user should reload the timer counter to zero, so it can produce period timer interrupt.
ticks
Number of ticks between two interrupts.
0 Function succeeded.
1 Function failed.
When the variable __Vendor_SysTickConfig is set to 1, then the function SysTick_Config is not included.
In this case, the file **<Device>.h** must contain a vendor-specific implementation of this function.
If user need this function to start a period timer interrupt, then in timer interrupt handler routine code, user should call SysTimer_SetLoadValue to set counter as 0 to reload the timer.
This function only available when __SYSTIMER_PRESENT == 1 and __ECLIC_PRESENT == 1 and __Vendor_SysTickConfig == 0
SysTimer_SetCompareValue; SysTimer_SetLoadValue

briefdescription.para: System Timer feature API header file for Nuclei N/NX Core.
